author: Staff Reporter
text:
Children can teach us a lot about environment and social issues through their innovative minds. ‘Save what saves you’, is the message that the tiny tots at Sri Kanchi Mahaswami Vidya Mandir conveyed through an exhibition on forests that was held on their campus in Tambaram.

Jezlyn Mariam Riju, an LKG student explained to the audience, “Felling trees, mining and industrialisation are the causes of deforestation. Whenever a tree is cut, let’s plant a new one,” she said. Girishanth R., another student of the same class said, “If trees are cut there is a disruption in the food chain and water cycle.” The students of class five had displayed structures and charts on national and international parks.

There was also a display on forests and the tribes. These students had put out an exhibit of vanishing tribes, details on tribal festivals and they had also carved tribal instruments with coconut shells. Visitors were excited about the charts by class IX students.

The main building of the school was also decorated to resemble a real forest. Spic Promoter A.C. Muthiah, who was the chief guest for the event, said he was inspired seeing all the exhibits. He also lauded the school’s Chairman V. Shankar for his novel ideas.
title: Tiny tots offer conservation tips
